total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the two distinct regions in the grid that are surrounded by non-zero values.
Q2: For each region, identify the unique non-zero values that are not part of the region's boundary.
Q3: For each region, create a new grid that only includes the region and its unique non-zero values identified in Q2.
Q4: For each new grid created in Q3, remove the boundary of the region.
Q5: Combine the two new grids created in Q4 into one grid, placing one grid on top of the other.
